lexUnit.name: glasses.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a pair of lenses set in a frame that rests on the nose and ears, used to correct or assist defective eyesight.

sentence.text: Before I had been there a month my eyes began to suffer and I had to start wearing glasses for close work .
USA Sport , a company aptly located in Oakley , Hampshire , markets a range of sports glasses for any prescription condition .
Between takes he waited outside the main hall with a helper to wipe his glasses for him in the close summer heat .
Dr Mackintosh was a red-faced Scot with mousy greying hair parted in the middle and tiny gold-rimmed glasses on the tip of his rather short nose .
Tom shook his head , adjusting the glasses on his nose .
He placed a pair of steel-rimmed glasses on Devlin 's nose and adjusted them .
His glasses with their steel frames made his eyes look chilly , merciless .
His glasses were dim and smeared .
After a reviving sip of coffee , she took a deep breath , flipped off her dark glasses , and fixed him with a level gaze .
He surveyed her doubtfully through his pebble glasses .
You are well advised , when the Whitney Biennial comes along , to be sure to remember your reading glasses .
He sent me there the other day to pick up his reading glasses .
She pulled her glasses from her pocket and placed them on the end of her nose .
Mr Sedgwick once again unfolded his glasses before studying the paper for several moments .
Let's have a look again , I 've got my glasses on now .
He was an old man , blinking behind very thick glasses .
Lucy had her serious office-work glasses on and a sheaf of papers .
She had dark glasses on .
She could see only through a watery mist and realized after a moment 's panic that she still had her reading glasses on .
So Wilson and I were quite chummy together , and he looked at me approvingly through his thick-lensed glasses as I sat talking with his wife about , for instance , winter tasks .
Swayne looked over his glasses .
He put on his glasses , walked over to the windows , and peered closely at the titles of the books .
The met man removed his glasses and , with his white handkerchief , commenced to polish them vigorously , considering the question for a moment .
Barak removed his glasses and rubbed his eyes wearily .
Frank took off his glasses and began to polish them in the sheet with enthusiasm .
He took off the phoney glasses and tweed hat and threw them to one side .
Thomas , sitting in a deep armchair in front of an open fire , was browsing through the newspaper and he took off his reading glasses to look her over .
A small , dapper , decisive man who wore a trilby and glasses , the canon lived in the next village and had a passion for small neat things like himself .
I wore my dark glasses even for these few moments , as my blue eyes were always straining in the brilliant light .
There was little light in the room but he wore wrap-around dark glasses .
He also wore metal frame square glasses because someone had told him he looked tough in them .
Dark glasses and make-up could n't hide the lines , and she sat with her face hidden in her hands in the back of the car .
Daisy Pettigrew changed her reading for her long distance glasses , so that she could see the vicarage garden more clearly .
Her bright hair was hidden under a sunhat , and she was disguised with dark glasses , but no one had shown the slightest interest in her .
